item.title: My explanation of the Discrete Fourier transform
item.author: Author
item.description: Why I directly write about the Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT) In the lectures from Steve Brunton and in the course that I took at ETH the Fourier analysis is thought by introducing the “Discrete Fourier Series” (a very related transformation) and maybe the “Discrete Time Fourier Transform” (another related transformation) before talking about the actual “Discrete Fourier Transform” (DFT). However at this point all lecturers tell you that the DFT is way more relevant in practice compared to the other topics.
